verses.verse: Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> was twelve <S%H8147><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> and five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%>

But did <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> like to the abominations <S%H8441><s%> of the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had cast <S%H3423><s%> out before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

For he built <S%H1129><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> the high <S%H1116><s%> places which <S%H834><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> his father had broken <S%H5422><s%> down, <S%H5422><s%> and he reared <S%H6965><s%> up altars <S%H4196><s%> for Baalim, <S%H1168><s%> and made <S%H6213><s%> groves, <S%H842><s%> and worshipped <S%H7812><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the host <S%H6635><s%> of heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and served <S%H5647><s%> them.

Also he built <S%H1129><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> whereof <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had said, <S%H559><s%> In Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> shall my name <S%H8034><s%> be for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

And he built <S%H1129><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> the host <S%H6635><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%> in the two <S%H8147><s%> courts <S%H2691><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

And he caused his children <S%H1121><s%> to pass <S%H5674><s%> through the fire <S%H784><s%> in the valley <S%H1516><s%> of the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hinnom: <S%H2011><s%> also he observed <S%H6049><s%> times, and used enchantments, <S%H5172><s%> and used witchcraft, <S%H3784><s%> and dealt <S%H6213><s%> with a familiar spirit, <S%H178><s%> and with wizards: <S%H3049><s%> he worked <S%H6213><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> to provoke him to anger. <S%H3707><s%>

And he set <S%H7760><s%> a carved <S%H6459><s%> image, the idol <S%H5566><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made, <S%H6213><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had said <S%H559><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> and to Solomon <S%H8010><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> In this <S%H2088><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and in Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have chosen <S%H970><s%> before all <S%H3605><s%> the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> will I put <S%H7760><s%> my name <S%H8034><s%> for ever: <S%H5865><s%>

Neither <S%H3808><s%> will I any more remove <S%H5493><s%> the foot <S%H7272><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> from out of the land <S%H127><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have appointed <S%H5975><s%> for your fathers; <S%H1><s%> so that they will take heed <S%H8104><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that I have commanded <S%H6680><s%> them, according to the whole <S%H3605><s%> law <S%H8451><s%> and the statutes <S%H2706><s%> and the ordinances <S%H4941><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Moses. <S%H4872><s%>

So Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> made Judah <S%H3063><s%> and the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to err, <S%H8582><s%> and to do <S%H6213><s%> worse <S%H7451><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had destroyed <S%H8045><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> and to his people: <S%H5971><s%> but they would not listen. <S%H7181><s%>

Why the LORD <S%H3068><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> on them the captains <S%H8269><s%> of the host <S%H6635><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> which took <S%H3920><s%> Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> among the thorns, <S%H2336><s%> and bound <S%H631><s%> him with fetters, <S%H5178><s%> and carried <S%H3212><s%> him to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

And when he was in affliction, <S%H6887><s%> he sought <S%H2470><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> his God, <S%H430><s%> and humbled <S%H3665><s%> himself greatly <S%H3966><s%> before <S%H854><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of his fathers, <S%H1><s%>

And prayed <S%H6419><s%> to him: and he was entreated <S%H6279><s%> of him, and heard <S%H8085><s%> his supplication, <S%H8467><s%> and brought <S%H7725><s%> him again <S%H7725><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> into his kingdom. <S%H4438><s%> Then Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> he was God. <S%H430><s%>

Now after <S%H310><s%> this <S%H3651><s%> he built <S%H1129><s%> a wall <S%H2346><s%> without <S%H2435><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> on the west <S%H4628><s%> side of Gihon, <S%H1521><s%> in the valley, <S%H5158><s%> even to the entering <S%H935><s%> in at the fish <S%H1709><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> and compassed <S%H5437><s%> about Ophel, <S%H6077><s%> and raised <S%H1361><s%> it up a very <S%H3966><s%> great height, <S%H1361><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> captains <S%H8269><s%> of war <S%H2428><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> the fenced <S%H1219><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah. <S%H3063><s%>

And he took away <S%H5493><s%> the strange <S%H5236><s%> gods, <S%H430><s%> and the idol <S%H5566><s%> out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the altars <S%H4196><s%> that he had built <S%H1129><s%> in the mount <S%H2022><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and in Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and cast <S%H7993><s%> them out of the city. <S%H5892><s%>

And he repaired <S%H1129><s%> the altar <S%H4196><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and sacrificed <S%H2076><s%> thereon <S%H5921><s%> peace <S%H8002><s%> offerings <S%H2077><s%> and thank <S%H8426><s%> offerings, and commanded <S%H559><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Nevertheless <S%H61><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> did sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> still <S%H5750><s%> in the high <S%H1116><s%> places, yet to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> their God <S%H430><s%> only. <S%H7535><s%>

Now the rest <S%H3499><s%> of the acts <S%H1697><s%> of Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> and his prayer <S%H8605><s%> to his God, <S%H430><s%> and the words <S%H1697><s%> of the seers <S%H2374><s%> that spoke <S%H1696><s%> to him in the name <S%H8034><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> they are written in the book <S%H1697><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

His prayer <S%H8605><s%> also, and how God was entreated <S%H6279><s%> of him, and all <S%H3605><s%> his sins, <S%H2403><s%> and his trespass, <S%H4604><s%> and the places <S%H4725><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> he built <S%H1129><s%> high <S%H1116><s%> places, and set <S%H5975><s%> up groves <S%H842><s%> and graven <S%H6456><s%> images, before <S%H6440><s%> he was humbled: <S%H3665><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> they are written <S%H3789><s%> among <S%H5921><s%> the sayings <S%H1697><s%> of the seers. <S%H2374><s%>

So Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers, <S%H1><s%> and they buried <S%H6912><s%> him in his own house: <S%H1004><s%> and Amon <S%H526><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> reigned <S%H4427><s%> in his stead. <S%H8478><s%>

Amon <S%H526><s%> was two and twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign, <S%H4427><s%> and reigned <S%H4427><s%> two years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

But he did <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> as did <S%H6213><s%> Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> his father: <S%H1><s%> for Amon <S%H526><s%> sacrificed <S%H2076><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> the carved <S%H6456><s%> images which <S%H834><s%> Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> had made, <S%H6213><s%> and served <S%H5647><s%> them;

And humbled <S%H3665><s%> not himself before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> as Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> had humbled <S%H3665><s%> himself; but Amon <S%H526><s%> trespassed <S%H819><s%> more <S%H7235><s%> and more.
And his servants <S%H5650><s%> conspired <S%H7194><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him, and slew <S%H4191><s%> him in his own house. <S%H1004><s%>

But the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> slew <S%H5221><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> them that had conspired <S%H7194><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> Amon; <S%H526><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> made Josiah <S%H2977><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> king <S%H4427><s%> in his stead. <S%H8478><s%>
